name: flowers #5
description:
I write in an attempt to find something deep
I let luck and destiny rest on these lines
simply, I think I have learned to desire the hidden
what is hidden from sight
the sun shines in the afternoon and the night peeks out
whispers a song, a flower, a poem
play that there is a diamond and you can find it
time has already played at being the moon, and it always understands
with the peace of knowing he is wise, old, he pretends nothing
the colors become wind without fear of love
these verses drank river water
in silence learned something from the fire
between the tiniest spark and the biggest bonfire perhaps there is only a puff away
we'll have to learn to blow
take care of the heat so that it doesn't escape between questions
life oscillates between snakes and butterflies
and even if time is nothing but an invention, a wall of cloud, of stone, of sky
long live the hour that brought you to the poem 
when in the field blooming flowers appear, I will know that we are already in spring.
